verses.verse: Then Elisha<WH477> said<WH559>, Hear<WH8085> ye the word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068>; Thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>, To morrow<WH4279> about this time<WH6256> shall a measure<WH5429> of fine flour<WH5560> be sold for a shekel<WH8255>, and two measures<WH5429> of barley<WH8184> for a shekel<WH8255>, in the gate<WH8179> of Samaria<WH8111>.

¶ And there were four<WH702> leprous<WH6879> men<WH582> at the entering in<WH6607> of the gate<WH8179>: and they said<WH559> one<WH376> to another<WH7453>, Why sit<WH3427> we here until we die<WH4191>?

And they rose up<WH6965> in the twilight<WH5399>, to go<WH935> unto the camp<WH4264> of the Syrians<WH758>: and when they were come<WH935> to the uttermost part<WH7097> of the camp<WH4264> of Syria<WH758>, behold, there was no man<WH376> there.

For the Lord<WH136> had made the host<WH4264> of the Syrians<WH758> to hear<WH8085> a noise<WH6963> of chariots<WH7393>, and a noise<WH6963> of horses<WH5483>, even the noise<WH6963> of a great<WH1419> host<WH2428>: and they said<WH559> one<WH376> to another<WH251>, Lo, the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> hath hired<WH7936> against us the kings<WH4428> of the Hittites<WH2850>, and the kings<WH4428> of the Egyptians<WH4714>, to come<WH935> upon us.

Wherefore they arose<WH6965> and fled<WH5127> in the twilight<WH5399>, and left<WH5800> their tents<WH168>, and their horses<WH5483>, and their asses<WH2543>, even the camp<WH4264> as it was, and fled<WH5127> for their life<WH5315>.

And when these lepers<WH6879> came<WH935> to the uttermost part<WH7097> of the camp<WH4264>, they went<WH935> into one<WH259> tent<WH168>, and did eat<WH398> and drink<WH8354>, and carried<WH5375> thence silver<WH3701>, and gold<WH2091>, and raiment<WH899>, and went<WH3212> and hid<WH2934> it; and came again<WH7725>, and entered<WH935> into another<WH312> tent<WH168>, and carried<WH5375> thence also, and went<WH3212> and hid<WH2934> it.

Then they said<WH559> one<WH376> to another<WH7453>, We do<WH6213> not well: this day<WH3117> is a day<WH3117> of good tidings<WH1309>, and we hold our peace<WH2814>: if we tarry<WH2442> till the morning<WH1242> light<WH216>, some mischief<WH5771> will come<WH4672> upon us: now therefore come<WH3212>, that we may go<WH935> and tell<WH5046> the king's<WH4428> household<WH1004>.

So they came<WH935> and called<WH7121> unto the porter<WH7778> of the city<WH5892>: and they told<WH5046> them, saying<WH559>, We came<WH935> to the camp<WH4264> of the Syrians<WH758>, and, behold, there was no man<WH376> there, neither voice<WH6963> of man<WH120>, but horses<WH5483> tied<WH631>, and asses<WH2543> tied<WH631>, and the tents<WH168> as they were.
And he called<WH7121> the porters<WH7778>; and they told<WH5046> it to the king's<WH4428> house<WH1004> within<WH6441>.

¶ And the king<WH4428> arose<WH6965> in the night<WH3915>, and said<WH559> unto his servants<WH5650>, I will now shew<WH5046> you what the Syrians<WH758> have done<WH6213> to us. They know<WH3045> that we be hungry<WH7457>; therefore are they gone out<WH3318> of the camp<WH4264> to hide<WH2247> themselves in the field<WH7704>, saying<WH559>, When they come out<WH3318> of the city<WH5892>, we shall catch<WH8610> them alive<WH2416>, and get<WH935> into the city<WH5892>.

And one<WH259> of his servants<WH5650> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>, Let some take<WH3947>, I pray thee, five<WH2568> of the horses<WH5483> that remain<WH7604>, which are left<WH7604> in the city, (behold, they are as all the multitude<WH1995> of Israel<WH3478> that are left<WH7604> in it: behold, I say, they are even as all the multitude<WH1995> of the Israelites<WH3478> that are consumed<WH8552>:) and let us send<WH7971> and see<WH7200>.

They took<WH3947> therefore two<WH8147> chariot<WH7393> horses<WH5483>; and the king<WH4428> sent<WH7971> after<WH310> the host<WH4264> of the Syrians<WH758>, saying<WH559>, Go<WH3212> and see<WH7200>.

And they went<WH3212> after<WH310> them unto Jordan<WH3383>: and, lo, all the way<WH1870> was full<WH4392> of garments<WH899> and vessels<WH3627>, which the Syrians<WH758> had cast away<WH7993> in their haste<WH2648>. And the messengers<WH4397> returned<WH7725>, and told<WH5046> the king<WH4428>.

And the people<WH5971> went out<WH3318>, and spoiled<WH962> the tents<WH4264> of the Syrians<WH758>. So a measure<WH5429> of fine flour<WH5560> was sold for a shekel<WH8255>, and two measures<WH5429> of barley<WH8184> for a shekel<WH8255>, according to the word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068>.

¶ And the king<WH4428> appointed<WH6485> the lord<WH7991> on whose hand<WH3027> he leaned<WH8172> to have the charge of the gate<WH8179>: and the people<WH5971> trode<WH7429> upon him in the gate<WH8179>, and he died<WH4191>, as the man<WH376> of God<WH430> had said<WH1696>, who spake<WH1696> when the king<WH4428> came down<WH3381> to him.

And it came to pass as the man<WH376> of God<WH430> had spoken<WH1696> to the king<WH4428>, saying<WH559>, Two measures<WH5429> of barley<WH8184> for a shekel<WH8255>, and a measure<WH5429> of fine flour<WH5560> for a shekel<WH8255>, shall be to morrow<WH4279> about this time<WH6256> in the gate<WH8179> of Samaria<WH8111>:

And that lord<WH7991> answered<WH6030> the man<WH376> of God<WH430>, and said<WH559>, Now, behold, if the LORD<WH3068> should make<WH6213> windows<WH699> in heaven<WH8064>, might such a thing<WH1697> be? And he said<WH559>, Behold, thou shalt see<WH7200> it with thine eyes<WH5869>, but shalt not eat<WH398> thereof.
And so it fell out unto him: for the people<WH5971> trode<WH7429> upon him in the gate<WH8179>, and he died<WH4191>.
